2301290.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301290
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 001
2301290.text: Abu Hurayra said, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was asked, 'Which people are the most generous?'' He replied, 'The most generous of them in the sight of Allah are those with the most taqwa.' They said, 'That is not what we are asking about.' He said, 'The most generous of people was Yusuf, the Prophet of Allah, son of the Prophet of Allah, who was the son of the Intimate Friend of Allah (Ibrahim).' They said, 'That is not what we are asking about.' He said, 'Are you asking about those of Arab origin?' 'Yes,' they replied. He said, 'The best of you in the Jahiliyya is the best of you in Islam when you have understanding from Allah)."

2301300.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301300
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 002
2301300.text: Mundhir at-Tawri reported what Muhammad ibn 'Ali (ibn al-Hanafiyya) said about, "Is the repayment of kindness anything except kindness?" He said, "It is not denied to either the pious or the deviant."

2301310.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301310
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 003
2301310.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The person who strives on behalf of the widows and poor is like those who strive in the way of Allah and like those who fast in the day and pray at night."

2301320.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301320
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 004
2301320.text: 'A'isha said, "A woman came to me who had two of her daughters with her. She asked me for something, but I could not find anything except for a single date which I gave her. She divided it between her daughters and then got up and left. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, came in and I told him what had happened. He said, 'Whoever looks after these girls in any way and is good to them will have them as a veil from the Fire.'"

2301330.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301330
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 005
2301330.text: Umm Sa'id bint Murra al-Fihri related from her father that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "I and the guardian of an orphan will be in the Garden like these two." (His two fingers)

2301340.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301340
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 006
2301340.text: Al-Hasan reported that an orphan used to eat with Ibn 'Umar. One day he called for food and looked for this orphan but could not find him. He arrived after Ibn 'Umar had finished. Ibn 'Umar called for more food to be brought to him but they did not have any. So he was brought sawiq and honey. He said, "Here, have this! By Allah, you have not been cheated!" Al-Hasan said, "By Allah, Ibn 'Umar was not cheated!"

2301350.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301350
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 007
2301350.text: Sahl ibn Sa'd reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "I and the guardian of the orphan will be in the Garden like that," indicating his forefinger and middle finger.

2301360.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301360
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 008
2301360.text: Abu Bakr ibn Hafs reported that 'Abdullah would not eat unless an orphan was at his table.

2301370.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301370
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 009
2301370.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The best house among the Muslims is the house in which orphans are well treated. The worst house among the Muslims is the house in which orphans are ill treated. I and the guardian of the orphan will be in the Garden like that," indicating his two fingers.

2301380.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301380
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 010
2301380.text: how ugly is misguidance after guidance! When you make a promise to your friend, fulfil your promise. If you do not, it will bring about enmity between you and him. Seek refuge in Allah from a companion who, when you mention something to him, does not help you and who does not remind you when you forget."

2301391.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301391
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 011
2301391.text: Al-Hasan said, "I remember a time among the Muslims when their men would shout (to remind their families), 'O family! O family! (Look after) your orphan! Your orphan! O family! O family! (Look after) your orphan! Your poor person! Your poor person! O family! O family! (Look after) your neighbour! Your neighbour!' Time has been swift in taking the best of you while every day you become baser."

2301392.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301392
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 012
2301392.text: Asma' bint 'Ubayd said, "I said to Ibn Sirin, 'I have an orphan in my care.' He said, 'Treat him as you would treat your own child. Beat him as you would beat your own child.'"

2301400.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301400
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 013
2301400.text: 'Awf ibn Malik reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "I and a woman who is widowed and is patient with her child will be like these two fingers in the Garden."

2301410.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2301410
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 014
2301410.text: Shumaysa al-'Atakiyya said, "The disciplining of orphans was mentioned in the presence of 'A'isha and she said, 'I would beat an orphan until he submits.'"
